author: TNN
title: ED questions two close associates of Anil Ambani

author: SANJAY DUTTA AND SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Data reveals the EU's significant role in Russia's fossil fuel revenues, surpassing India's contribution since the Ukraine conflict began. Despite Western sanctions, G7+ tankers transport over half of Russia's oil, highlighting a disconnect between policy and practice. While Russia's fossil fuel revenues have decreased, exports have increased, with India emphasizing its role in stabilizing global oil prices.
title: Finland-based thinktank exposes US double standard

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: PM Modi emphasized the need for India to attract global consumers, tourists, and students, urging citizens to enhance productivity. He highlighted the government's focus on infrastructure development and transparent governance, noting that over Rs 4.3 lakh crore has been saved by eliminating fraudulent beneficiaries through Jan Dhan, Aadhaar, and Mobile integration. Redevelopment of government offices will further save public expenditure.
title: India should capture world's mindspace: PM

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Supreme Court judges are expressing serious concerns over a recent order by Justices Pardiwala and Mahadevan, which criticized an Allahabad High Court judge and removed him from criminal cases. This action is seen as a breach of established SC rulings that designate the High Court Chief Justice as the sole authority for case allocation.
title: SC judges take exception to order against HC judge

author: TNN
description: Following the Flight AI 171 crash in Ahmedabad, Air India is launching a campaign to rebuild passenger confidence. MD and CEO Campbell Wilson assures customers of their safety through rigorous processes and advanced technology. The airline is gradually restoring international services, aiming for full resumption by October 1, while implementing detailed inspections and strengthened safety systems.
title: Your trust is valued, journey safeguarded, AI CEO tells flyers

author: SRISHTI LAKHOTIA
description: Calcutta High Court's Jalpaiguri circuit bench commuted Aftab Alam's death sentence to life imprisonment without parole for 20 years in his uncle's murder case. The court emphasized reform over revenge, stating the trial court relied more on emotion than facts.
title: Calcutta HC commutes death sentence, says justice must not be 'bloodthirsty'

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court overturned a murder conviction. The court stated that an accused's suspicious behavior isn't enough for a guilty verdict. There must be more evidence. The judges set aside earlier rulings. They emphasized conduct is just one factor. It needs strong support. An FIR admitting guilt is not fully admissible.
title: Doubtful conduct of an accused not enough for conviction: SC

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court addressed the widespread practice of naming welfare schemes after politicians, both at the state and central levels. It overturned a Madras High Court order against Tamil Nadu's 'Ungaludan Stalin' scheme and penalized AIADMK MP C Ve Shanmugam with ₹10 lakh for singling out the TN scheme while similar schemes exist elsewhere.
title: SC allows use of Stalin's name in TN schemes, says other govts do it too

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump indicated a potential meeting with Vladimir Putin to discuss the Russia-Ukraine war, following White House confirmation of openness to such talks. This comes after a US envoy's discussions in Moscow with Putin, and a call between Trump, Zelensky, and NATO leaders. Trump has given Russia until Friday to show progress toward peace or face new sanctions.
title: ‘Very soon’: Trump to meet Putin for first time in term two; to push end to Russia-Ukraine war

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: A six-year-old Indian-origin girl in Waterford City was racially abused and physically assaulted by a group of teenagers, prompting outrage. In a separate incident, Laxman Das, an Indian sous chef in Dublin, was attacked and robbed while going to work. These incidents follow a series of recent assaults targeting Indians in Ireland, raising concerns about racism.
title: 6-year-old PIO girl and Indian chef latest to be attacked in Ireland

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Kansas City Chiefs' tight end Travis Kelce, 35, dismisses retirement talks despite entering his 13th NFL season. Kelce's sharp response to retirement questions during training camp indicates his focus remains on football. Coach Andy Reid affirms Kelce's importance to the team, while teammate Patrick Mahomes highlights Kelce's improved physique and dedication.
title: 'Ask me that when I retire': Travis bluntly shuts down retirement talk; fans react to his confidence

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Dwyane Wade's past divorce from Siohvaughn Funches resurfaced due to accusations of transmitting an STD, which he vehemently denied. Wade detailed the ordeal in his book, highlighting the defamation suit he filed and the subsequent withdrawal of claims. Despite the controversy and public scrutiny, Wade moved on, finding love with Gabrielle Union.
title: Dwyane Wade’s scandal recall: Ex-wife's STD claim; 'The gossip went global,' NBA star says

author: TNN
description: The Election Commission (EC) refuted allegations from opposition MPs Asaduddin Owaisi and Randeep Surjewala regarding the Bihar electoral roll revision, urging them to facilitate claim filings for allegedly excluded voters. The EC highlighted the low number of claims filed by party booth level agents despite reported irregularities. The revision aims to improve electoral processes, including limiting voters per booth.
title: EC to opposition: Get 'wrongfully excluded' to file claims

author: TNN
description: In a rare occurrence, both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha passed two shipping bills on the same day amidst opposition protests. The Merchant Shipping Bill, 2025, aims to modernize maritime governance and promote India's role in global trade.
title: In a 1st: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha pass two bills of same ministry on same day

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has voiced strong disapproval of the continued use of hand-pulled rickshaws in Matheran, calling it an affront to India's progress and constitutional values. The court directed the Maharashtra government to create a scheme within six months to replace these with e-rickshaws, drawing inspiration from a successful model empowering tribal women in Gujarat.
title: India's dignity belittled by hand-pulled rickshaws: SC

author: SUBODH GHILDIYAL
description: The INDIA bloc is set to march to the Election Commission on August 11, protesting alleged manipulation of votes, particularly concerning the revision of Bihar's electoral rolls. Opposition leaders accuse the Modi government of concealing information by refusing to discuss the matter in Parliament, leading to disruptions during the Monsoon session.
title: Opposition: Government evading SIR debate; has lot to hide

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: In a strategic offseason decision, the Toronto Maple Leafs have decided to retain forward Nick Robertson despite ongoing NHL trade rumors. With Auston Matthews leading the franchise's charge toward Stanley Cup contention, the team is focusing on long-term potential. Robertson's youth and offensive upside give him an edge over trade candidates like David Kampf and Calle Jarnkrok.
title: Maple Leafs' playoff gamble: Nick Robertson stays; Auston Matthews eyes deeper NHL run

author: TNN
description: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, maintaining a neutral stance. While retaining the FY26 growth forecast at 6.5%, the MPC lowered the inflation projection to 3.1%. This decision considers macroeconomic conditions, the need for further transmission of rate cuts, and favorable monsoon conditions, despite lingering global trade challenges and geopolitical uncertainties.
title: RBI keeps rates on hold, cuts inflation estimate for FY26

author: SIDHARTHA
description: Indian businesses anticipate significant order losses during the festival season due to Donald Trump's 50% tariffs on exports to the US, making competition with other countries difficult. Exporters are hoping for a breakthrough in trade negotiations, but many orders are already on hold as buyers reassess sourcing. Diversification is challenging as China increases its focus on European and other markets.
title: Trump tariffs: Exporters on edge, fear losing orders

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: A six-year-old Indian-origin girl in Waterford City was racially abused and physically assaulted by a group of teenagers, prompting outrage. In a separate incident, Laxman Das, an Indian sous chef in Dublin, was attacked and robbed while going to work. These incidents follow a series of recent assaults targeting Indians in Ireland, raising concerns about racism.
title: 6-year-old PIO girl and Indian chef latest to be attacked in Ireland

author: OMER FAROOQ KHAN
description: Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir's rise in Pakistan, following a military standoff with India, signals a shift towards greater military influence. Despite denials, speculation persists about his expanding role in civilian affairs. Amidst economic challenges and internal strife, Munir's hardline stance towards India and crackdown on dissent, including Imran Khan's imprisonment, raise concerns about the nation's trajectory.
title: Asim Munir’s grip on power deepens Pakistan’s militarisation

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Jammu and Kashmir's Chief Minister, Omar Abdullah, has appealed to national parties, including the BJP, to reinstate statehood for J&K, emphasizing it as a constitutional right, not a discretionary favor. He argues that downgrading a state to a Union Territory sets a dangerous precedent, urging a bill in Parliament's current session.
title: Omar writes to all political parties for J&K’s statehood, calls it ‘essential course correction’

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: A special NIA court in Jammu has charged three Jamaat-e-Islami operatives and a trust for allegedly raising and using funds to promote the banned organization's activities, violating the UAPA. The accused include Amir Mohammad Shamsi, Abdul Hamid Ganai, and Pakistan-based Mushtaq Ahmad Mir, along with the Al-Huda Educational Trust. Evidence includes witness statements, financial records, and money transfers.
title: Terror funding: Special NIA court frames charges against Jamaat-e-Islami trio, trust

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India secured a thrilling six-run victory against England in the fifth Test at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance, claiming 5 for 104 and 23 wickets in the series, earned him Player of the Match. A lighthearted moment followed as Arshdeep Singh playfully mimicked a fan chanting for Yashasvi Jaiswal, showcasing the team's camaraderie.
title: Arshdeep mimics fan's 'Jaiswal' chant in girly voice, Yashasvi can't stop laughing

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Brazil has approached the World Trade Organization regarding US tariffs. These tariffs impact a significant portion of Brazilian exports. President Lula intends to discuss the matter with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Xi Jinping. The US has also sanctioned a Brazilian Supreme Court Justice. This action is related to the trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro.
title: Brazil Protests 50% Tariffs at WTO; Lula Plans Talks with Modi, Xi

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Boris Johnson has endorsed Donald Trump's decision to impose an additional 25% tariff on India, asserting it's a justified response to New Delhi's support for Vladimir Putin amidst the Ukraine conflict. Johnson criticized European nations, including Britain, for their reluctance to penalize countries funding Russia's war efforts.
title: 'India enabling Putin's butchery': Ex-UK PM Johnson backs Trump's additional tariff; lauds US president

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: PM Narendra Modi is likely to visit China for the Shanghai Cooperation Summit in late August, hosted by President Xi Jinping. Preparations are underway for India's participation, with a potential bilateral meeting between Modi and Xi on the agenda.
title: PM Modi may visit China for the 1st time in 7 years; visit amid trade standoff with US

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US envoy Steve Witkoff met with Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin for three hours amidst efforts to end the Ukraine war. This meeting occurred before a deadline for Russia to agree to peace or face new sanctions. Donald Trump hinted at diplomatic progress, stating the meeting was "highly productive.
title: Russia-Ukraine war: Trump hints at shifting peace deal deadline; aide holds 'productive' talks

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The Trump administration has discontinued the weekly email directive, initiated by the Department of Government Efficiency under Elon Musk, that required federal workers to list five accomplishments. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) stated the policy was inefficient and will transition agencies to stricter performance management systems with regular employee check-ins.
title: Trump admin rolls back DOGE diktat: 'We communicated with agency HR leads that ...

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: US President Trump's imposition of a 25% additional tariff on Indian exports due to Russian oil purchases is poised to negatively impact India's economy, particularly affecting textile, marine, and leather sectors. Experts view this as a pressure tactic amid ongoing trade deal negotiations, potentially hindering India's GDP growth and straining trade relations.
title: Trump's 50% tariff shock: How will it impact Indian economy? Explained

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded Gautam Gambhir for his conviction and support of emerging talent during India's Test series in England, despite facing criticism. Sidhu highlighted Gambhir's role in providing opportunities to players like Akash Deep and Washington, emphasizing the team's spirited performance and commendable draw achieved despite missing key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
title: Big revelation! 'It was Gautam Gambhir who insisted on this transition'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first building under the Common Central Secretariat project, symbolizing a shift from colonial-era administration to democratic values. The building will house key ministries and aims to improve efficiency, save taxpayer money, and provide modern amenities. Modi emphasized that policies for a developed India will be framed in these Kartavya Bhavans.
title: Kartavya Bhawan: PM Modi explains meaning behind name of India's new power hub

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump imposed a 25% tariff on Indian goods due to India's Russian oil purchases. This action doubles existing tariffs. Analysts warn this could hurt US consumers and businesses. Clayton Seigle from CSIS, said tariffs may increase inflation. India is a key trade partner. The tariff could strain relations and impact global oil market stability.
title: Tariff trap: Trump targets India to pressure Putin - but US may pay the price

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: US: 5 soldiers shot at army base in Georgia; active shooter prompts full lockdown

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India has strongly condemned the US's decision to impose an additional 25% tariff on Indian crude oil imports from Russia. The Ministry of External Affairs labeled the move 'unfortunate,' emphasizing India's commitment to safeguarding its energy security and national interests. This decision places India at a competitive disadvantage in the US market, potentially impacting trade relations between the two nations.
title: 'Will take action': India defiant after Trump's 50% tariff blow; what MEA said

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: LeBron James is gearing up for his 23rd NBA season, prioritizing fitness to maintain peak performance. He's been spotted engaging in rigorous workouts, including Pilates sessions with his wife, Savannah. Their joint fitness efforts have garnered attention, with fans reacting to their dedication and speculating about James' future in the league.
title: LeBron joins Savannah for Pilates after workout near Clippers banner

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Edward Coristine, a former DOGE employee, intervened in a carjacking in D.C., sustaining injuries while protecting a woman. The incident unexpectedly united Donald Trump and Elon Musk, who both voiced support for Coristine and criticized D.C.'s crime rates. This rare alignment between the two influential figures has reignited discussions about public safety and Coristine's profile as a public figure.
title: Who is Edward Coristine? Ex-DOGE staff saves woman from attack; praised by Trump, Musk

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi criticized US President Trump's increased tariffs on India as "economic blackmail" to force an unfair trade deal. He alleged PM Modi's silence on the issue stems from a US investigation into Adani and potential exposure of financial links. India defended its right to pursue energy policies based on national interest amidst the tariff threats.
title: 'Attempt to blackmail India': Rahul on Trump's extra 25% tariff; targets PM

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: It had all the trappings of wealth—heated sidewalks, a taxidermied tiger, seven floors of Versailles-by-way-of-psychodrama—and yet its most valuable commodity wasn’t luxury. It was leverage. Because Epstein didn’t just collect art or investments. He collected people.
title: 'Castle Dracula': Inside Epstein's mansion where Trump dined and Chomsky wrote

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Dharali destroyed: New drone footage shows horrifying extent of damage - watch

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Tesla shareholders have filed a lawsuit accusing Elon Musk and the company of securities fraud, alleging they concealed safety risks associated with Tesla's self-driving technology, including the Robotaxi. Musk responded on X, dismissing the lawsuit as driven by opportunistic class-action lawyers. The lawsuit seeks damages for investors, claiming Tesla exaggerated autonomous driving capabilities, leading to inflated stock value.
title: Elon Musk responds to shareholders' lawsuit: ‘They are scum of the Earth. The worst….’

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Raksha Bandhan, a Hindu festival, celebrates the bond between siblings. Sisters tie Rakhi on their brother's wrist. This signifies love and protection. The article provides messages, quotes, and wishes for Raksha Bandhan 2025. It includes images and GIFs for the festival. The content focuses on expressing love and strengthening sibling relationships. It shares greetings for a joyous celebration.
title: Happy Raksha Bandhan 2025: Wishes, quotes, images, gIFs & messages

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating helicopter crash in Ghana has claimed the lives of eight individuals, including two prominent government ministers: the defence minister and the environment minister. The helicopter, en route to a gold-mining region, lost contact before the tragic incident. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of this national tragedy, marking one of Ghana's worst aviation disasters in recent years.
title: Helicopter crash in Ghana: 8 killed; defence, environment ministers among dead

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Beets, a nutritional powerhouse, offer numerous health benefits but concern kidney stone sufferers due to their high oxalate content. Experts suggest boiling or fermenting beets to reduce oxalate levels significantly. Pairing them with calcium-rich foods like yogurt aids oxalate binding in the gut, preventing kidney stone formation.
title: Love beets, but worried about kidney health? Here's how to prevent kidney stone risk

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court has directed the election commission of India (ECI) to provide detailed information by August 9 regarding the removal of approximately 65 lakh voters from Bihar's draft electoral rolls. This directive follows a plea by an NGO seeking clarity on the reasons for these deletions, whether due to death, relocation, or other factors.
title: SC to ECI: Explain 65L missing Bihar voters; ADR questions mass deletions

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's stellar performance led India to a 2-2 series draw in England, despite the absence of key players. Gill amassed 774 runs, averaging 75.40, with four centuries. His remarkable scores included a high of 269 at Edgbaston.
title: Shubman Gill's full list of records from the England series

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: US President Trump touts billions in tariff revenue, but its use remains unclear. While the government collected nearly $30 billion last month alone, a 242% increase, the funds enter a general Treasury pool. Trump proposed debt reduction or rebates, yet neither materialized.
title: Trump’s tariff treasure: US ‘taking in so much money’ – but where is it going?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Google's Kaggle Game Arena witnessed a thrilling start as Gemini 2.5 Pro, o4-mini, Grok 4, and o3 secured dominant victories in the AI chess exhibition tournament. These LLMs defeated formidable opponents, showcasing their strategic capabilities. Grok 4's impressive performance drew attention, with Elon Musk acknowledging xAI's minimal focus on chess.
title: Gemini vs Grok vs Claude vs DeepSeek: Which AI tool is best for chess?

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Following Hulk Hogan's sudden death from cardiac arrest, his daughter Brooke Hogan speculated about foul play, citing concerns over improper medication and privacy violations by medical staff. Despite these concerns and the absence of an autopsy, Clearwater Police Department found no evidence of foul play.
title: Hulk Hogan’s death: Cops address foul play concerns in WWE icon’s sudden death

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India defeated England by six runs in the final Test, leveling the series. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets, earning praise from Asaduddin Owaisi. Siraj was named Player of the Match. Shubman Gill captained the team after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's retirements. Gill also received the Player of the Series award.
title: Mohammed Siraj's classy reply to Owaisi's viral 'poora khol' comment

author: RAJIV KALKOD
description: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar faced scrutiny after riding a scooter with ₹18,500 in unpaid traffic fines during a Hebbal flyover inspection. The JD(S) party highlighted the pending fines and questioned the legality of the half-helmets worn by Shivakumar and his companion.
title: Scooter DKS rode has Rs 18,500 in fines; owner pays Rs 1K after viral ride

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on India due to its continued purchase of Russian crude oil, despite prior warnings. Trump stated India is 'fuelling the war machine' and expressed dissatisfaction with the trade relationship. India's foreign ministry has defended its position, citing national interests and accusing the US and EU of hypocrisy in their own dealings with Russia.
title: Trump follows through on tariff threat! What US prez's order says

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Senator Tom Cotton is questioning Intel's choice of Lip-Bu Tan as CEO, citing concerns over his ties to Chinese firms and a past criminal case involving Cadence Design during Tan's leadership. Cotton's letter to Intel's board chair seeks clarity on Tan's disclosures regarding Chinese investments, especially given Intel's role in securing the microelectronics supply chain for defense.
title: US Senator sends letter to Intel Board on CEO Lip-Bu Tan's 'China ties'

author: LITHA ACHARI
description: Govt. High School, Dongargaon in Burhanpur district, Madhya Pradesh, has pioneered a 'U-shape' seating arrangement, inspired by Kerala, to eliminate the concept of 'backbenchers.' Principal Jagdish Patil's initiative fosters dialogue, inclusivity, and leadership by positioning students face-to-face with the teacher. Following its success in Class 10, Class 9 students requested the same arrangement, drawing interest from other district schools.
title: Watch: School ditches 'backbencher' setup; inspired by Malayalam film

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Tesla's chief designer, Franz von Holzhausen, addressed the 2019 Cybertruck window shattering incident, calling it a "Murphy's law" moment. Despite the mishap during the launch, where a metal ball cracked the armored glass, Tesla turned it into a marketing opportunity. CEO Elon Musk acknowledged the need for improvement and the company even launched a T-shirt featuring the shattered window design.
title: Tesla design chief on when he shattered glasses of Cybertruck behind Elon Musk: It was ...

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Bill Gates warns Gen Z that AI proficiency alone won't guarantee job security. Entry-level positions are declining due to automation. Traditional roles are vanishing as companies adopt AI. Many young people are now exploring skilled trades and people-centric careers. Adaptability and emotional intelligence are becoming vital. Gen Z must reinvent themselves to secure their future.
title: Bill Gates warns Gen Z: AI will wipe out entry-level jobs, don’t rely on tech alone

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the first Kartavya Bhavan at Kartavya Path in Delhi, marking a significant step towards a developed India. He emphasized that the building symbolizes India's transformation and will be a hub for shaping policies for a 'Viksit Bharat'. The new complex aims to modernize administrative infrastructure, fostering collaboration among ministries and saving approximately Rs 1,500 crore annually.
title: 'Direction of nation will be decided from here': What PM Modi at Kartavya Bhawan

author: ARNAB MUKHERJI
description: Prasidh Krishna's impressive comeback in the fifth Test against England, where he claimed eight wickets, played a crucial role in India's victory. After facing criticism and being dropped, Krishna refined his approach, displaying improved consistency and tactical awareness. His performance offers India confidence in his potential for Test matches, particularly in SENA countries, despite likely limited opportunities at home.
title: EXCLUSIVE | Prasidh's coach: 'He played into England's hands initially, pulled off a 3-card trick later'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Narendra Modi will visit China for the SCO Summit. This is his first visit since the Galwan clash. The visit happens amid trade issues with the United States. Donald Trump threatens higher tariffs on India. India defends its energy strategy. Ajit Doval is in Moscow for talks on strategic partnership. Discussions will include Russian oil supplies to India.
title: PM Modi likely to visit China: First trip to Beijing since 2020 Galwan clash

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Anaya Bangar, daughter of former Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar, recently shared photos on Instagram dressed in a saree, referencing Kareena Kapoor's iconic 'Poo bani Parwati' look. Anaya, who underwent gender affirmation surgery, previously spoke about the “toxic masculinity” prevalent in cricket.
title: 'Poo bani Parwati': Anaya Bangar wears mom's saree, recreates iconic Kareena Kapoor moment from K3G

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect' ignited fan speculation. KL Rahul shared an adorable photo of his daughter, Evaarah, holding his finger, melting hearts online. Khushboo Patani, Disha's sister, threatened legal action against trolls spreading misinformation. Yuzvendra Chahal congratulated RJ Mahvash, dismissing dating rumors. Mukesh Khanna defended Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win, emphasizing his deserving dedication to cinema.
title: Top 5 entertainment news: Fans react to Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A bizarre incident in Bihar's Samastipur district has emerged during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, where an online application was filed claiming US President Donald Trump as a resident. The application included Trump's photo and his parents' names. Authorities rejected it and filed an FIR.
title: Trump a Bihari? Fake certificate names US prez as Samastipur local

author: LITHA ACHARI
description: Govt. High School, Dongargaon in Burhanpur district, Madhya Pradesh, has pioneered a 'U-shape' seating arrangement, inspired by Kerala, to eliminate the concept of 'backbenchers.' Principal Jagdish Patil's initiative fosters dialogue, inclusivity, and leadership by positioning students face-to-face with the teacher. Following its success in Class 10, Class 9 students requested the same arrangement, drawing interest from other district schools.
title: Watch: School ditches 'backbencher' setup; inspired by Malayalam film

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Nitish Rana expressed his desire for Jaideep Ahlawat to portray him in a biopic, citing their shared Jaat heritage and Ahlawat's Haryanvi speaking ability. Rana, known for his street-style fashion, revealed that he adopted his ponytail from Shah Rukh Khan.
title: Will 'Paatal Lok' star Jaideep Ahlawat play cricketer Nitish Rana in his biopic?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee spearheaded a massive protest rally in Jhargram, condemning alleged attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants and accusing the BJP of orchestrating a campaign of harassment. Banerjee vowed to expose the BJP if attacks on Bengali language and people continue, asserting that Bengali identity will not be silenced.
title: Bengali row: Mamata leads rally; attacks Centre over NRC, voter list revision

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra refuted Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark, asserting India's strong economic performance and significant contribution to global growth, exceeding that of the United States. Despite concerns over potential US tariffs due to India's energy ties with Russia, Malhotra assured a stable inflation outlook, with authorities prepared to intervene if global oil prices rise to protect consumers.
title: 'India contributes more than US': RBI guv on Trump's 'dead economy' jab

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sachin Tendulkar believes India's Test wins without Jasprit Bumrah were coincidental, emphasizing Bumrah's "exceptional" quality. Despite Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance, Bumrah remains a top performer. Tendulkar also lauded Washington Sundar's all-round contributions and defended India's decision to play on during the Manchester Test, supporting the team's spirit and dismissing concerns about England's bowlers needing rest before the final Test.
title: 'Just a coincidence': Tendulkar on India winning without Bumrah

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI has introduced gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, two new open-weight AI models designed to empower developers with cost-effective AI solutions. The gpt-oss-120b model matches the performance of OpenAI's o4-mini and can run on a single GPU, while the gpt-oss-20b is optimized for devices with limited memory. These models are available under the Apache 2.
title: OpenAI launches new open-source AI models: Altman says, ‘This release will…’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi Assembly witnessed a tumultuous session as AAP MLAs, including Atishi, were marshalled out following a dispute with BJP members over the authenticity of a structure on the premises. The BJP claims the renovated site, inaugurated as a British-era execution chamber, was actually a tiffin room, accusing the AAP government of historical manipulation.
title: ‘Phansi Ghar’ row: Atishi evicted from Delhi assembly; AAP seeks ASI survey

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A cloudburst near Harsil in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered a flash flood, leaving 11 Indian Army jawans missing. Rescue teams, including the NDRF and Army personnel, are working tirelessly in challenging conditions to locate the missing soldiers. The area is isolated due to road breaches and a collapsed bridge, complicating relief efforts.
title: Uttarakhand floods: 11 Army jawans missing; rescue ops underway

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Afghanistan was struck by a 4.4 magnitude earthquake on Wednesday at a depth of 155 kilometers, following a 4.2 magnitude quake earlier in the day. This seismic activity is part of a series of recent earthquakes in the region, including a 5.5 magnitude quake on August 2.
title: Afghanistan earthquake: Two tremors strike region within hours; no damage reported so far

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Mallikarjun Kharge has urged the Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman to allow a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, emphasizing its critical importance to voters, especially those from weaker sections. He referenced a past ruling affirming the House's right to discuss matters of fundamental democratic importance like electoral roll revisions.
title: Bihar SIR row: Kharge seeks discussion in RS; writes to Deputy Chairman

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: A tech startup CEO's decision to delete his Instagram account, declaring it's "time to be a man," has sparked widespread discussion. Elon Musk endorsed the move, echoing his criticism of Meta's platforms for superficial engagement and privacy concerns.
title: 'Deleting Insta, not just app, the whole account,' writes startup CEO; Elon Musk responds

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Harry Brook, despite being named Player of the Series by Gautam Gambhir, believed Joe Root was more deserving due to his consistent performance throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series. Brook acknowledged Root's higher run tally and overall impact, highlighting his teammate's enduring class. The series concluded in a 2-2 draw, showcasing a thrilling battle between England and India.
title: Harry Brook disagrees with Gautam Gambhir: 'Didn’t score as many runs ...'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The BJP plans to file a contempt of court petition against Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her remarks defending Rahul Gandhi after the Supreme Court criticized his comments during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. BJP MP Manan Kumar Mishra deemed her statements "irresponsible.
title: 'Irresponsible statements': BJP to file contempt petition against Priyanka's SC remarks

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first building under the Common Central Secretariat project, designed to consolidate government offices for improved efficiency. Key ministries, including Home Affairs and External Affairs, will relocate from Raisina Hills to this modern, energy-efficient complex. The broader Central Vista redevelopment aims to modernize government infrastructure and consolidate operations by June 2027.
title: Kartavya Bhawan inaugurated; key things to know about high-tech building

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nvidia addresses concerns about its H20 AI chips in China. The company denies any backdoors or security risks. Nvidia's chief security officer, David Reber, assures that the chips are secure. Nvidia also pushes back against proposals for mandatory kill switches in chips. They argue such measures would harm trust and create vulnerabilities.
title: Nvidia posts a long message for China with an appeal to the US govt, says: There is no such thing as good …

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Despite US President Trump's threats of increased tariffs on India due to its oil trade with Russia, the EU and America continue to import billions worth of Russian energy and commodities. India has called out this hypocrisy, highlighting the significant trade relations that persist between the West and Russia, including LNG, uranium, and fertilizers.
title: Reality check: US, Europe import goods worth billions from Russia; where India stands

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Abhishek Nayar, after his departure from the Indian cricket team's coaching staff, has rejoined Kolkata Knight Riders as a mentor in the IPL. He's also taken on a mentorship role with the UP Warriorz in the WPL, aiming to cultivate a winning culture. Nayar highlighted the significant progress in women's cricket, noting the increased power and athleticism in the game.
title: 'That mentality ... ': Sacked by BCCI, ex-India coach finally breaks silence on KKR return

author: TOI Education
description: Despite a 39% rise in MBBS seats in India from 2020–21 to 2024–25, over 2,800 seats remain vacant. Data tabled in the Lok Sabha reveals gaps linked to high private fees, complex counselling, and low uptake in newer colleges. While infrastructure expands, persistent underutilisation raises concerns about accessibility, affordability, and systemic inefficiencies in medical admissions.
title: Thousands of medical seats are going vacant: What’s really wrong with MBBS admissions in India?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Australia Champions faced a narrow one-run defeat against South Africa Champions in the World Championship of Legends semi-final, despite strong performances from Dan Christian and Peter Siddle. Post-match, Brett Lee connected with fans, sharing a wholesome moment with a young Sikh supporter. South Africa Champions ultimately won the tournament, defeating Pakistan Champions in the final.
title: Watch: Brett Lee wins hearts by folding hands, saying 'Sat Sri Akaal' to young Sikh fan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In Fatehpur, Swami Prasad Maurya faced an attack. A Karni Sena worker, disguised as a supporter, slapped him during a welcome ceremony. The attacker blended into the crowd. Police are investigating the incident and the attacker's motive. Maurya has been in the news for controversial remarks on Hinduism. His comments have sparked outrage among Hindu groups.
title: Watch: Karni Sena worker tries to slap Swami Maurya in Fatehpur; arrested

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance at The Oval, Virat Kohli's sister, Bhawna Kohli Dhingra, lauded his efforts in India's victory against England. Siraj, the series' leading wicket-taker, received praise from Virat Kohli and a warm welcome upon his return to Hyderabad. His crucial nine-wicket match haul at The Oval secured a narrow win for India, drawing the series 2-2.
title: 'You are great': Virat Kohli's sister pens emotional note for Siraj - READ

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: After gathering the courage to tell her family. Rasika began treatment. She said, "The treatment was brutal. I lost 10 kgs. My skin broke out in painful rashes. I covered every mirror at home because I couldn’t bear to see myself. Amidst all this, there were nights I’d stay up & wonder, ‘Should I just end it here?’ But, I found slivers of strength–from the quiet corners of my being, & from my family & friends who refused to let me give up."
title: IITian, 26, non-smoker, gets stage 3 lung cancer: "The treatment was..."

author: TOI Education
description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has mandated 75% minimum attendance for Class 10 and 12 students in the 2025–26 session to qualify for the 2026 board exams. Strict exemptions, surprise inspections, and zero tolerance for manipulated records underscore the board’s renewed push to curb dummy candidates and enforce academic discipline across affiliated schools.
title: CBSE mandates 75% attendance for board exam eligibility: Rule effective from 2026; key details

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra downplayed fears of significant inflation from reduced Russian oil imports, citing diversified sources and potential government fiscal measures. His remarks come amid US tariff threats over India's Russian oil purchases, which India has rejected. Despite geopolitical tensions, the RBI held its repo rate steady, forecasting stable growth and controlled inflation.
title: If India cuts Russian crude under US pressure, will inflation rise? RBI guv responds

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: NSDL shares debuted strongly on Wednesday, listing at a 15% premium over the issue price of Rs 800, reaching Rs 920 and a market valuation of Rs 18,249 crore. The Rs 4,011 crore IPO was oversubscribed 41 times.
title: NSDL IPO listing: Company makes strong debut; shares list 15% higher than issue price of Rs 800

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Perplexity, an AI search startup, faces allegations from Cloudflare of using deceptive tactics to bypass website restrictions. Cloudflare claims Perplexity's bots disguised themselves as regular users to scrape content from blocked domains, raising concerns about unauthorized data usage. Perplexity denies wrongdoing, attributing the activity to third-party traffic and user-driven requests.
title: Perplexity under fire: Cloudflare says AI bots faked identities to bypass site blocks

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy concluded in a 2-2 draw, marked by the controversial handshake refusal by Jadeja and Sundar in the fourth Test. Sachin Tendulkar has strongly defended the Indian team's decision, emphasising the strategic advantage of tiring out England's bowlers before the crucial fifth Test. He lauded Sundar's adaptability and reiterated his full support for the team's approach.
title: Sachin breaks silence on handshake drama, asks 'Why should bowlers be kept fresh?'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra acknowledges the difficulty in predicting the impact of potential US tariffs on India's GDP growth. While the central bank retained its 6.5% GDP forecast for fiscal year 2025-26 and kept the repo rate unchanged, Malhotra emphasized ongoing global uncertainties.
title: Trump's tariff threat on India: What RBI guv Sanjay Malhotra said on GDP growth

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Army revisits the 1971 war with Pakistan. Newspaper clippings from 1971 show Pakistan's military buildup. They also highlight unrest in then-East Pakistan. The US backed Pakistan during the war. This reminder follows India's rejection of US criticism over energy trade with Russia. Tensions between India and Pakistan are currently high after a terror attack.
title: 'Another Pak diplomat quits': Army recalls 1971 war 'build-up'; highlights it in 'this day that year' post

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance in England, RP Singh cautioned against overworking him, emphasising the need for careful workload management akin to Jasprit Bumrah to prevent potential burnout. Singh highlighted Siraj's indispensable role and partnership with Bumrah, advocating for strategic team selections and like-for-like injury substitutions to maintain team balance and player well-being.
title: 'Don't burn him out': Ex-India pacer sounds alarm, says Siraj is in Bumrah's league

author: TUSHAR DUTT
description: Abhinav Bindra supports India's ambition to host the 2036 Olympic Games, emphasizing its potential to inspire a generation and drive national development. He stresses the importance of focusing on athlete development and building robust sports systems. Bindra believes that investing in athletes and grassroots participation is crucial for India to be competitive by 2036.
title: EXCLUSIVE | ‘If we are serious about 2036 bid...’ - Abhinav Bindra

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has threatened to impose substantial tariffs on India for continuing to purchase Russian oil, despite criticism from within his own party. Nikki Haley cautioned against harming relations with India while seemingly giving China a pass. India has defended its oil imports, citing diverted traditional supplies and pointing out that other nations also trade with Russia.
title: 'I never said a percentage': Trump on increasing tariffs on countries buying Russian oil

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Opposition INDIA bloc leaders are set to convene in Delhi on August 7 to strategize against PM Modi's alleged misinformation ahead of assembly polls. Discussions will encompass the Pahalgam attack and 'Operation Sindoor,' alongside concerns regarding Bihar's voter list revision.
title: INDIA bloc to meet at Rahul's residence on Aug 7- What's on the agenda

author: GAURAV GUPTA
description: Sanju Samson will remain with Rajasthan Royals. He will not be traded before the 2026 Indian Premier League. Recent speculation linked him to Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. Rajasthan Royals have decided to retain Samson. He is an integral part of the team. Samson is also the captain. He aims for a strong performance in the upcoming season.
title: IPL Rumours: Sanju Samson to stay! RR captain not going anywhere

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Indian cricketer KL Rahul shared heartwarming photos from his England break, including a touching image of his baby daughter Evaarah clutching his finger. The post, which also featured moments with his brother-in-law Ahan Shetty, quickly garnered love from fans and family. Suniel Shetty and Ranveer Singh expressed their affection, celebrating the sweet family moments of Rahul and Athiya Shetty.
title: KL Rahul melts hearts as he shares pic of daughter Evaarah holding his finger

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Microsoft is considering a stricter 'Return to Office' policy, potentially requiring Redmond employees to work from the office at least three days a week starting January 2026. This shift marks a change from their flexible hybrid model, aligning Microsoft with companies like Amazon and Dell.
title: Microsoft planning stricter 'return to office' policy, requiring employees to ...

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Mohali blast: 2 killed, three injured in explosion at oxygen cylinder plant

author: TOI Education
description: The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has released a revised Round 1 schedule for NEET UG 2025 counselling, following an abrupt suspension of the choice filling process. The updated timeline, issued on August 6, extends key deadlines including registration, now open until 3 PM today. The move brings clarity for medical aspirants and resumes the AIQ admission process.
title: NEET UG round 1 revised counselling schedule: Key updates out- check imp dates

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rashid Khan marked his return to competitive cricket with a historic milestone, becoming the first player to reach 650 T20 wickets. Playing for Oval Invincibles in The Hundred 2025, he took 3/11 against London Spirit, showcasing his spin mastery. His performance, combined with Sam Curran's, led the Invincibles to a comfortable victory, starting their title defense strongly.
title: T20 History! Rashid Khan shines at Lord’s, becomes first bowler ever to ...

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following cloudbursts and continuous rainfall in Uttarakhand, cricketer Rishabh Pant expressed his concern for those affected and urged them to stay strong. The rising water level in the Ganga River prompted alerts, while Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami surveyed affected areas and initiated large-scale rescue operations involving multiple agencies to save stranded individuals amidst flooding and landslides.
title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: Roorkee-born Pant 'deeply saddened' as devastation hits Uttarkashi

author: KAUTILYA SINGH
description: Dharali, near Gangotri, faces recurrent floods from the Kheer Gad river, turning disaster into a seasonal norm. Villagers brace for the river's sudden surges, marking years by flood events rather than festivals. Despite past incidents causing significant damage to homes and livelihoods, no lives were lost between 2010 and 2018.
title: 'It just arrives': The violent rhythm of Dharali's Kheer Gad; history of floods, absence of safety

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Swapnil Ramesh Tejale, an Indian citizen, faced arrest in the US. The arrest occurred due to possession of a fake resident card. Authorities took him into custody in Niagara Falls, New York. He faces a potential 10-year prison sentence. The arrest is part of 'Operation Take Back America'. This initiative targets illegal immigration.
title: Forged resident card: Indian man arrested in New York; faces 10 years in jail

author: NITIN NAIK
description: Mohammed Siraj’s fiery spirit defined India’s drawn Test series in England. Overlooked, misjudged, and trolled, he rose through relentless spells, emotional resilience, and raw hunger. From rubber slippers in Toli Chowki to nine SENA wins, Siraj’s journey is a testament to belief. At The Oval, he didn’t just take wickets — he emerged from Bumrah’s shadow.
title: IND vs ENG: Mohammed Siraj conquers snubs, trolls and misfortune

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant demonstrated his compassionate side by assisting Jyoti Kanaboor Math, a bright student from Karnataka, in achieving her academic aspirations. Despite scoring 83% in her Class 12 exams, Jyoti faced financial constraints that threatened her BCA enrollment. Pant's timely intervention, a Rs 40,000 donation, ensured her admission and first-semester fees were covered, earning him gratitude and admiration.
title: 'Means a lot': Pant wins hearts, funds college admission for a student

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: The entertainment industry celebrated the National Awards, but Shah Rukh Khan's first win sparked debate. South actress Urvashi questioned the fairness, while Mukesh Khanna defended SRK, highlighting his decades of hard work. Khan expressed gratitude, viewing the award as a reminder of his responsibility to cinema and a motivation to continue striving.
title: Mukesh Khanna defends SRK's National Award win

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi has accused PM Modi of being unable to confront President Trump's tariff threats due to the ongoing US investigation into Adani. Gandhi alleges that Modi's silence stems from potential exposure of financial links between Modi, Adani, and Russian oil deals. The opposition has been criticizing PM Modi and the BJP government over Trump's tariff threats and penalties for business with Russia.
title: 'Reason he can't stand up to Trump is ...': Rahul's fresh charge at PM

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The RBI's MPC has maintained the repo rate at 5.5% in its August review, offering no immediate EMI relief for borrowers, despite previous cuts. While a 1% repo rate reduction this year hasn't fully translated to lower EMIs, expectations are for future reductions. This decision occurs amidst potential tariff hikes by the US due to India's oil trade with Russia.
title: Repo rate kept unchanged at 5.5%; what does it mean for your loan EMIs?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched an investigation into a Rs 260 crore global cyber fraud, conducting searches across multiple cities. Fraudsters impersonated law enforcement and tech support to extort money from victims. The illicit funds were converted into cryptocurrency, then laundered through hawala channels and individuals in the UAE.
title: Rs 260cr global cyber fraud: Fake cops, money laundering via crypto; ED raids 11 locations

author: ABHAY
description: Delhi Police successfully solved the chain snatching case involving Tamil Nadu MP R Sudha near the Poland Embassy in Chanakyapuri. The accused was apprehended, and the stolen gold chain, weighing over four sovereigns, was recovered. Police traced the suspect using CCTV footage, identifying a blue scooter used in the crime, leading to the arrest in connection with the high-profile incident.
title: TN MP chain snatching case solved: Accused nabbed in Delhi; scooter hunt leads to arrest

author: TOI Education
description: Uttarakhand authorities have shut all schools and Anganwadi centres in Almora, Pithoragarh, Chamoli, and Rudraprayag districts following an IMD warning of heavy rainfall. The move aims to protect students amid flash flood and landslide risks. Haridwar faces waterlogging, while a boulder on the Haridwar-Dehradun rail route has disrupted train services, prompting high alert across the state.
title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: Rain alert forces school closures across four districts

author: TOI Education
description: Thousands of international students remain stranded as US visa delays under the Trump administration disrupt fall enrollments, threatening billions in tuition revenue. Universities like Arizona State and Furman report significant shortfalls, while students face rejections and lack of appointments. Institutions scramble with backup plans abroad, as America’s higher education appeal faces serious global erosion.
title: Visa delays strand students: Thousands stuck abroad; US colleges face financial hit

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva plans to challenge Donald Trump's 50% tariffs by contacting global leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping. Despite tensions, Lula will use the WTO to defend Brazil's interests. He refuted Trump's justification for the tariffs, viewing it as an attack on Brazil's sovereignty.
title: 'Will call PM Modi': Brazil's Lula snubs Trump amid tariff row

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Toronto Maple Leafs are in turmoil after trading Mitch Marner to Vegas Golden Knights. Nicolas Roy joined the Leafs. Nick Robertson is now a potential trade target, with Pittsburgh showing interest. Kyle Dubas, now with Pittsburgh, drafted Robertson. Robertson's future with the Leafs is uncertain. The team must decide if he is a long-term asset or a trade piece.
title: Marner trade rocks Leafs; buzz grows around possible Nick Robertson deal

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In the last week of July, the government announced a new plan to increase the birth rate. Parents will receive an annual subsidy of 3,600 yuan (about $500) for every child until the age of three. This scheme applies to children born since January 1, 2025. Over three years, a family can get up to 10,800 yuan for each child.
title: Baby bonus: China offers 10,800 yuan per child to boost birth rate

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Paris-bound plane from Madrid was compelled to make an emergency landing shortly after takeoff due to a bird strike, causing panic among passengers. The collision severely damaged the plane's nose, leading to smoke in the cabin and the deployment of oxygen masks.
title: Bird slams into plane: Cabin filled with smoke mid-air on Paris flight— watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Chennai Grand Masters 2025 has been delayed by a day due to a fire at the Hyatt Regency, its venue. All players are safe and relocated. The tournament will now commence on August 7, with the first round on the original rest day.
title: Chennai Grand Masters: Tournament postponed after fire disrupts venue - Watch

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold prices are expected to remain range-bound with limited upward movement in the near term, according to Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. Despite a Friday rally driven by weak US job data and tariff concerns, a stronger US Dollar and risk-on sentiment are capping gains.
title: Gold price prediction: Where is yellow metal rate headed? Here’s the outlook

author: GAURAV TALWAR
description: A man miraculously survived a flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village on Tuesday. Dramatic videos show him crawling from the debris after the deluge destroyed homes and roads. Though injured and covered in mud, he managed to escape the immediate danger. His identity and condition remain unknown, and it's unconfirmed if he received medical attention.
title: ‘Bhag, bhag!’: Man defies death, crawls out of debris as flash flood flattens Uttarkashi village - watch

author: ARANI BASU
description: Shubman Gill and Gautam Gambhir's coach-captain partnership has started strongly, drawing a challenging five-Test series in England. Gill's leadership and Gambhir's focus on team over individuals have instilled confidence in a young Indian side. With senior players retiring and Bumrah's availability managed carefully, the team is looking ahead, potentially revisiting ODI leadership with Gill as a key figure.
title: IND vs ENG: Transition is over! Gill & Gambhir deliver powerful statement

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A devastating flash flood struck Dharali village in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, triggered by a cloudburst. The deluge of water and debris flattened buildings, trapping dozens and resulting in casualties. Rescue operations are under way by army and NDRF teams, with efforts focused on clearing debris and restoring connectivity amidst challenging weather conditions. PM Modi assured full central support to CM Dhami.
title: Uttarakhand flash floods: Homes buried, roads blocked; PM Modi speaks to CM Dhami - latest developments

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mohammed Siraj, the Indian pace sensation, returned to India after a stellar performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker with 23 scalps. His crucial spells, including a six-wicket haul at Birmingham and a five-wicket spell at The Oval, solidified his role as a key figure in India's pace attack, especially with Bumrah's absence.
title: Watch: Siraj arrives in India after stellar England series, fans hail ‘Miyan Magic’

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump expressed outrage over rising crime in Washington, DC, threatening federal intervention after a Department of Government Efficiency member, Edward Coristine, was assaulted during a carjacking attempt. Trump demanded stricter laws to prosecute juvenile offenders as adults, emphasising the need for a safe and clean capital. Elon Musk also highlighted the incident, calling for federalising DC.
title: 'Going to exert my powers': Here's why Trump has warned of federal control in DC

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shashi Tharoor has stirred debate by questioning Virat Kohli's Test retirement, deeming it premature after India's drawn series in England. He contrasted Kohli's situation with Joe Root's continued excellence, emphasising Kohli's potential impact on the recent series. Tharoor's appeal highlights Kohli's past success and leadership, igniting calls for his return to Test cricket.
title: 'Languishes in premature retirement': Tharoor reignites call for Kohli's Test comeback

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Hundred 2025 began at Lord's with a nostalgic reunion for Sunrisers Hyderabad fans as David Warner and Kane Williamson batted together for London Spirit. Despite the heartwarming moment, Oval Invincibles dominated, bowling out Spirit for 80. Rashid Khan and Sam Curran starred with the ball. The Invincibles chased the target swiftly, winning by six wickets.
title: Nostalgia for SRH fans: Warner, Williamson walk out together to bat – Watch

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Ajit Doval's Moscow visit centers on strengthening the strategic partnership, defense, and security cooperation between India and Russia amid evolving geopolitical dynamics. Discussions will encompass defense collaboration and Russian oil supplies to India. The visit occurs against the backdrop of US trade threats and criticism regarding India's energy imports from Russia, which India defends as safeguarding its national interests.
title: NSA Doval in Russia amid Trump tariff threat: Key talks with Kremlin; will oil be on agenda?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in flat in trade on Wednesday ahead of the RBI monetary policy review decision.
title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 80,700 ahead of RBI policy decision

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Amidst criticism over India's Russian oil purchases, US President Donald Trump claimed ignorance about the US importing fertilizers and chemicals from Russia. He accused India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and threatened tariff hikes, prompting a strong rebuttal from India, which cited strategic necessity and questioned the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing their trade with Russia.
title: Trump was asked about India’s claim on US importing Russian uranium, fertilisers; his response

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Yograj Singh praised Mohammed Siraj, drawing comparisons to Kapil Dev, and lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy amidst initial criticism. He emphasized the team's fighting spirit, viewing the series draw against England as a hard-fought victory. Yograj expressed immense pride in the Indian team's resilience and determination throughout the series, highlighting their unwavering commitment.
title: WATCH: 'Bande in taange jama di goron ki' – Ex-India cricketer on Siraj

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former Australian cricketer Brad Haddin sparked debate by suggesting Jasprit Bumrah didn't secure Test wins for India during their England tour, despite being their leading wicket-taker. Haddin praised Mohammed Siraj's leadership and eagerness in crucial moments, highlighting his resilience and impact on the team's performance, ultimately helping India level the series 2-2.
title: 'Bumrah didn’t win the Test match — Siraj did,' says ex-Australia cricketer

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Edward Coristine, a former DOGE employee, was violently attacked during an attempted carjacking in DC's Logan Circle. He was defending a woman when a group of teenagers assaulted him, leading to the arrest of two 15-year-olds. The incident has fueled President Trump's call for federal control of DC, citing out-of-control crime and the need to try minors as adults.
title: Ex-DOGE employee aka ‘big balls’ assaulted in DC: Why was he attacked; who was behind it?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mohammed Siraj has emerged as India's leading pacer in away Tests, surpassing Jasprit Bumrah. His stellar performance in the recent India-England series, where he took 23 wickets, solidified his position. Siraj's impactful spells, including a six-wicket haul at Birmingham and a crucial five-for at The Oval, were instrumental in India's victories.
title: 'Miyan Magic' tops the charts: Siraj surpasses Bumrah for this big record

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Anand Rathi Shares suggests buying GRSE, Redington, and Raymond Realty. GRSE shows mean reversion and weekly reversal patterns. Redington indicates hidden bullish divergence and pullback setup. Raymond Realty displays momentum revival after correction.
title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for August 6

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Dinesh Karthik criticised Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's leadership during the recent Test series against England, suggesting their cautious approach reflected a fear of defeat. Karthik highlighted Gambhir's significant influence on team decisions and emphasised the need to prioritise taking wickets. He also defended Jasprit Bumrah's workload management, dismissing claims that India performs better without him.
title: 'Picked a team not to lose': Ex-India cricketer slams Gambhir-Gill approach

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's film 'Saiyaara' sees a drop in collections. The movie earned Rs 2.50 crore on its third Tuesday. Its total collection stands at Rs 304.60 crore. New releases like 'Mahavtar Narsimha', 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' pose competition. 'Saiyaara' faces a challenge with the upcoming release of 'War 2'.
title: 'Saiyaara' collection: Ahaan Panday’s romantic film slows down to Rs 2.5 cr

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump hinted at potential tariff actions against countries like India and China for importing energy from Russia, citing concerns about fueling the war in Ukraine. He expressed dissatisfaction with India's trade practices and hinted at substantially raising tariffs due to their continued oil trade with Russia.
title: Trump eyes tough tariffs: Targets nations buying Russian oil; claims 'talks with Russia soon'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a bizarre interruption at Lord's, a fox stole the show during The Hundred 2025 opener between London Spirit and Oval Invincibles. The furry intruder halted play, sparking amusement among spectators and commentators alike. Despite the delay, Oval Invincibles secured a six-wicket victory, chasing down London Spirit's 81-run target with Rashid Khan's stellar performance earning him Player of the Match.
title: WATCH: Fox on the field! Lord’s crowd erupts as wild visitor interrupts game

author: SHIVANI AZAD
description: Environmentalists suggest that unchecked construction and human activity within the Bhagirathi Eco-Sensitive Zone exacerbated the recent devastating flood in Dharali village. They highlight that unregulated development disrupts natural drainage and accelerates land degradation. Experts are calling for stricter land-use regulations, comprehensive climate monitoring, and sustainable tourism practices to protect the vulnerable Himalayan ecosystem.
title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Rules flouted for profit? Experts blame unchecked construction, tourism push

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Alex Ovechkin, the Washington Capitals icon, is partnering with Yandex to produce a documentary chronicling his illustrious hockey career and life beyond the ice. The film, produced by Plus Studio and streamed on KinoPoisk, will explore his journey from Russia to NHL stardom, highlighting his leadership, Stanley Cup victory, and deep connection to both Moscow and Washington, D.C.
title: Alex Ovechkin’s next chapter: Yandex-backed docu project; NHL star goes beyond the ice

author: NANDINI SEN GUPTA
description: After a period of softening, commodity prices are rising again, prompting auto companies to implement minor price hikes. Steel price increases, in particular, are causing concern, with analysts predicting continued hardening of raw material prices in the coming quarters. While the immediate impact on margins is limited, auto bosses are closely monitoring the situation as a potential headwind.
title: As costs pinch, auto companies hike prices

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Can I say I won them athletically': Trump jokes after receiving 1984 Olympic medals

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, passed away on July 24, 2025, at 71. A private memorial service is scheduled for August 5 in the Tampa-Clearwater area for family and close friends. Following the service, Hogan will be cremated at Sylvan Abbey Memorial Park in Clearwater, his final resting place. Florida has declared August 1st "Hulk Hogan Day" in his honor.
title: Hulk Hogan’s final memorial: WWE legend honored; date and location officially revealed

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Despite facing competition, 'Son of Sardaar 2' has maintained a steady performance at the Indian box office, earning approximately Rs 2.50 crore on Day 5, bringing its total to around Rs 29.60 crore. The film's consistent weekday numbers and positive word-of-mouth suggest it will continue its momentum into the second weekend. 'Mahavatar Narsimha' continues to dominate the box office.
title: 'Son of Sardaar 2' box office collection Day 5: Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur starrer sees steady growth; matches 'Saiyaara' collections on Tuesday

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Totally out of control': Trump wants minors prosecuted; threatens federal control of DC

author: TNN
description: Indians are increasingly financing their vacations with personal loans, surpassing home renovations and medical needs as the primary reason. A recent report indicates that 27% of borrowers took loans for travel in the first half of 2025, fueled by millennials and a rapidly growing Gen Z segment.
title: Travel loans overtake house renovation, medical: Study
